page.title: 20EMERGENCY SERVICES
page.content: The most common cases {STRATHCLYDE {POLICE}deal with are vandalism and theft.There are very few serious crimes with only 3-4 murders a year in the town.There are 339 people working in one station,there are 42 cars per division.The police say unemployment has no effect on the crime rate.Other than investigating crimes the police do a number of support jobs such as traffic control.{The Fire Service}has to fight 2500 fires a year About 6 fires a year are serious and result in death.The station has 90 staff. There are 2 {Fire Fighting }engines each carrying 5 persons,2 turntable ladders which carry 3 persons and the emergency support unit carries 2 people.The service covers from Bowling to Drumchapel and all Clydebank. Clydebank does'nt have an{Ambulance Service,depending on the Glasgow one.
